EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network  
Purpose: Automates raw material processing via smelting.  
Components: Stone furnaces interconnected by burner‑inserters, wooden chests acting as buffers, and transport belts that provide material routing between units. All elements remain as previously established.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup  
Purpose: Facilitates the extraction of iron ore and its conveyance toward processing areas.  
Components: A burner‑mining drill with its adjacent wooden chest, several burner‑inserters lining the extraction site, and transport belts that channel the mined ore. This setup is unchanged from the historical report.

### Steam Power Generation System  
Purpose: Generates electrical power from steam energy.  
Components: A boiler located at Position(8.0, 20.5) with connection points at approximately (8.5, 18.5) and (8.5, 22.5), and multiple steam engines placed at various positions (e.g. (0.5, 9.5), (18.5, 11.5), (1.5, 13.5), (13.5, 14.5), (19.5, 14.5), (22.5, 18.5), (17.5, 20.5), (12.5, 21.5), (4.5, 23.5)). Notably, an extra steam engine remains in inventory due to unresolved spatial congestion issues around the boiler area.

### Automation Research Lab  
Purpose: Conducts technological research using science packs.  
Components: Laboratory units that process automation‑science‑packs; these labs intermittently experience issues with power connectivity but remain otherwise intact.

### Offshore Pump and Fluid Network  
Purpose: Secures a steady water supply for fluid processes.  
Components: An offshore pump positioned at (0.5, 30.5) linked to a network of pipe groups that distribute water across the map. The layout and connections are as previously reported.

### Electricity, Transport, and Fluid Infrastructure  
Purpose: Provides the foundational network for power distribution, material logistics, and fluid transport.  
Components: Electricity groups formed by arrays of power poles, belt groups that interconnect production sites, and pipe groups that maintain dedicated fluid systems. These interconnected networks have not seen any structural changes.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue  
  – The extra steam engine remains unplaceable due to persistent spatial congestion. Overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts in the boiler zone (notably near Position(8.0, 20.5) and around (8.5, 22.5)) prevent the formation of a clear build area.  
  – Mitigation Strategies:  
     • Remove or reposition conflicting entities (such as burner‑inserters and transport belts) in and around the boiler zone to clear sufficient build space.  
     • Adjust the design of adjoining connection interfaces to ensure that expansion space is available for additional power generation units.  
     • Consider relocating the extra steam engine to a less congested area or redesigning the boiler layout to resolve the placement bottleneck.
